bug.short_desc: When item names are too long in a VirtualSelectBox / VirtualComboBox, show tooltips.

long_desc.thetext:
The qx.ui.core.Widget has a property called "toolTipText"[1] which in my opinion is not used enough within the Qooxdoo framework. It is actually quite a standard practice to display tooltips within a UI whenever text is too long to be displayed within a Widget.
My suggestion targets VirtualSelectBox (and probably VirtualComboBox) but I guess the implementation of this can be more general. I suggest that either whenever the text is too long, the toolTipText will be set to the label of the item which is too long, or that there will be a property which controls the appearance of toolTipText in general (e.g. add to VirtualSelectBox a boolean property which, when set, always binds the toolTipText and label properties of a list item).
Best wishes, Omri
[1] http://demo.qooxdoo.org/1.5.x/apiviewer/#qx.ui.core.Widget~toolTipText

As was also discussed on the mailing list [1], a neat feature would be to make the width of the "dropdown" widget in the VirtualSelectBox grow in case it is too small, up to a preset maximal width, or in general simply to be able to set the width of the dropdown widget separately from the width of the VirtualSelectBox itself.
[1] http://qooxdoo.678.n2.nabble.com/VirtualSelectBox-changing-the-width-of-the-attached-list-tc7070737.html
